texts.text: Over the course of the night, I made love to Rin many times.
Even while taking a shower together we sought each other, and after moving to bed, we greedily wanted more.
At the end of it all, I fall into a deep sleep, completely spent.
I wake up to find Rin reading the manuscript next to me.
I get up and leave the bedroom.
Recovering the shirt I haphazardly threw to the floor of the dressing room yesterday, I retrieve a cig from its pocket.
It's a little crumpled from getting wet and drying out again, but it'll do. I pop it in my mouth, go to the kitchen, and light it up below the ventilation fan.
Part of the paper is discolored.
And the filter feels really squishy. Must have been the water.
As I look up at the smoke getting sucked out by the fan, I remember Rin as she was last night.
I can still hear her calling out my name.
The way she straddled me with her legs open wide and looked down at me with a satisfied smile on her face.
The memory is so vivid I can feel my pants getting tight already.
I close my eyes and try to keep her away from my thoughts, to little success.
I finish smoking and turn off the fan.
Returning to the bedroom, I stare at her from the doorway.
She's silently reading the manuscript.
She has only a few pages left.
Did she not sleep?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I've got half a mind to brew some coffee.
She raises her face from the papers.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: There's some drip coffee left from last time.
I nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll use that. You want some?
She slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll make some for myself when I'm done reading. Go ahead.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: All right.
She smiles at me before turning her attention back to the manuscript.
I sit at the table and stare vacantly at the ceiling and walls while I drink my coffee.
I stay there a while after finishing until Rin shows up holding the manuscript.
All she's wearing is a T-shirt as she pads around barefoot.
Memories from last night flash through my mind and I quickly look away from her.
I'm not sure if she noticed or not, but she directs a suggestive smile at me and sits across the table.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think I would like you to do me some, after all.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Coffee.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Sure.
No way that ambiguous wording wasn't on purpose.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Give me some?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Of course.
I get up and brew her some more coffee.
I glance back at her as she looks out the window.
On the table rests my empty mug and the manuscript.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Here you go.
I set the mug in front of her.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Thanks.
She looks up at me and smiles.
I sit down opposite her and watch as she sips her coffee.
She's wearing that funny daruma bird T-shirt that I bought for her in Sakuragicho.
She puts the mug down on the table and sighs.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I read it.
I nod in response.
Clasping the mug with both hands, she looks up at me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It was really good.
Loose-jawed from the surprise, I simply stare at her.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think this writing is really good. I don't think it'd make for a good book as it is right now, though.
I nod, still unable to say anything.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Reading it, I fell in love all over again.
She says, the sweetest of smiles adorning her face.
In my shock, I'm unable to do much besides let my gaze swim and my mouth flap like a fish's.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah! What is it? Cat got your tongue?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No, err, I just...
She giggles, her eyes still set on me.
I feel so uncomfortable.
And yet, at the same time, so happy and at peace.
Even though I know I'm just dancing on the palm of her hand right now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I didn't expect praise like that from you.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You're such a bad liar. There's no way you could have written that unaware.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I bet you knew I'd read it and fall hopelessly in love with you. There's no doubt in my mind.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Am I wrong?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Err, I...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Could it be that this was your intention all along?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Not at all.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's a little hard to believe, judging from the night we had.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think I would've taken a shower first if that's what I was planning to do.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: And I would have actually bought some protection while I was at the convenience store.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah!
Visibly amused, she laughs out loud.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Good response!
I nod.
And she nods back cheerfully.
She puts the mug to her lips and keeps sipping.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Thank you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh?
She murmurs, looking down at the table.
I notice that her tone of voice has changed.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I could really feel just how much love you have for me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Your writing made me feel the peace of mind one usually only feels after being loved for years.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Reading it made me feel glad to be alive.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: And it's thanks to you.
She lovingly looks into my eyes as she speaks.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It made me feel like maybe, if there's someone out there who loves me so much, being alive a little longer wouldn't be so bad.
Unable to find the words, I simply keep nodding in response.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I felt your love in a deeper way than all the times you made love to me. Though I enjoyed that in its own right as well.
She lets out a devilish giggle.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I'll get in shape so I can satisfy you.
She nods, a sly grin spreading across her face.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll be waiting with bated breath.
After that, she takes another sip of coffee.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Have you decided what to do next?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What to write.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nah.
I shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I haven't thought about it at all. To be honest, I feel like I've let everything I had bottled up inside out.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: When I was writing, I couldn't think about anything but the words before me, and you.
She smiles.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I haven't decided what to write, or if I'm even gonna write again at all.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think you should write.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm sure you should.
She sounds so matter of fact about it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If you could put your feelings to paper like that just to show them to me, I'm sure you can write anything.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If you found a message that made you feel strongly enough, I'm sure you could write something that would appeal to the general public instead of just me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But I don't have a message that would interest the general public like you say.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's a lie if I've ever heard one. Right here in these pages, you wrote about so many things in life you're dissatisfied with.
She points to the manuscript.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I want to read even more of your writing.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: And that's why you've gotta write. How else can I read more?
I could stare at that smile all day.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Okay, but...
She cocks her head and looks at me curiously.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But next time we've gotta read each other's writing.
She opens her eyes wide in surprise.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You want me to write something too?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'd like that. Otherwise I can't read your writing either.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: No way.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Hahahah!

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What's so funny?!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nothing, I just kind of think...
I stare into her eyes.
She meets my gaze with her own.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think you can write. I think you should. I'm sure you could write some good stuff.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Because I'm the daughter of a famous writer?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Because you're that kind of person. Your blood has nothing to do with it.
She giggles and gives me a small nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think you should. And more than that, I want to read it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If you write, I'll write. Sounds like a fair exchange to me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You really think I can do it?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I know you can.
Rin seems to be in deep thought.
Then she quirks the corners of her mouth and gives me a mischievous smile.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: So, say I do manage to write something... I'd like a reward for my effort.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Really now?
She nods.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Well, if I can make it happen, then sure.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You've gotta submit your next work for a rookie award.
I stare at her in disbelief.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If you promise to do that, I feel like I could give it my best shot.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin, I...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, come on! It's a fine goal, no? Let's do it during the summer break.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If I can finish writing one piece, you'll submit yours for a rookie award.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It'll be our summer battle.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I bet it'll make for one memorable summer, right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: We're on, then!
She gives me a playful smile.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You got me good, huh?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, and one more thing.
She gives me another one of those smug, sly looks.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Put something on. You're gonna get me all hot and bothered remembering last night.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Are you doing it on purpose?
She says, dexterously raising one eyebrow at me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh...
I clear my throat.
At the ripe old age of 45, I find myself clearing my throat after being caught with my pants down, literally.
I use the washing machine in Rin's house to clean my clothes. One single button press and it does all the work. Truly, we have come far as a species.
After changing into my now clean clothes, I head to Shuho's studio to pick up my bag.
It's still pretty early.
I had lunch with Rin while I waited for my laundry to be done.
Rin said that she would make dinner tonight.
I think she's out shopping while I go get my stuff.
Now that I think about it, it'll probably be the first real meal I've had in a good while.
I feel strange.
My feet are so light they barely feel attached to me.
I have so much to think about.
I skipped work without explanation.
I'm now in a relationship with a student.
And the woman I'm in the process of divorcing saw me locking arms with her.
If I'm not careful, I might have a lot of explaining to do.
The worries pile up and make me want to sigh, yet my heart feels radiant.
Maybe the part of my brain that regulates anxiety is truly broken.
Like a junkie in the middle of his high.
But there is something that backs up this peppy spring in my step.
Rin herself. And while it's true that she's in my life for now...
Despite my obvious lack of morals, I'm a grown man.
I know that her fiery passion won't last forever.
But that's fine.
It doesn't deter the happiness I'm feeling.
As long as she lives on somewhere, and she's happy in the future, I will be too.
When I take my first step inside the studio I freeze, stunned.
Was the air in this place always so stagnant?
Did I really find this space comfortable?
I shudder.
My stench after spending all that time here unwashed hangs like grime clinging to a wall.
Intermingled with it is the scent of death.
No one can stay in this place.
That's what my instincts tell me.
I feel the stomach-churning fear of a person who unknowingly crosses a flimsy log bridge with a blindfold on, only to look back and realize how lucky he was.
One wrong step, and I would have been dead.
Subconsciously, I recognize the danger I was in.
This heavy atmosphere crushes the spirit.
No amount of ventilation could save this place.
I collect my laptop from the desk and throw the bag over my shoulder.
Back at the entrance, I take one last look at the room.
Hatano Shuho wasn't the perfect man I thought him to be.
But the power of his writing was the real deal.
His memories have the power to pull the reader into the same state of mind that he was in.
That's a power I don't have.
And I don't think I want it anymore.
I don't want to make Rin feel even an ounce of the suffering I did.
I want to deliver her a story of salvation, even if it's make-believe.
Even if it's not to remain with her for long, a story that could, just for a moment, light up her heart.
I don't mind being a shallow minstrel.
Shuho's diaries, his creative materials and reference books.
I slowly look it all over, committing to memory this room that I won't ever see again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I wish we could have shared drinks when you were still around.
I mutter that to the silent room, and turn off the lights.
On my way to the front door, my gaze wanders towards the bathroom.
Through the polished glass, I can clearly see the darkness that lies within.
The life-engulfing darkness lies there, like a bottomless pit, spreading out into the beyond.
I won't come here again.
I'll give the key back to Rin.
I put my shoes back on, leave Shuho's studio, and lock the door behind me.
When I make it back to Rin's apartment building, my phone vibrates.
I expect it to be a message from Rin, but I'm wrong.
It's an email in my inbox.
I'm unable to contain my laughter when I read it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Welcome back.
When I open the door, Rin comes over to greet me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nice to be back.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You barely packed anything.
Surveying my luggage, Rin giggles to herself.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I was only planning to stay the weekend.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Well, we're in summer break now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, really? It slipped my mind.
At the time I was absent from work and Watanabe called, there should have been three days left until the end-of-semester ceremony.
I did feel like I stayed in that room for longer than three days.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's been about a week since summer break started. You were holed up in the studio for ten days.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Whoa, really?
I'm speechless.
She looks up at me curiously.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: When I went back just now...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I was surprised at how oppressive the air was.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I can't believe I was in there for ten whole days.
Rin nods, a smile of relief forming on her face.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think that's the normal reaction to have.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm really glad you came back.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It's thanks to you.
I take the chance to pick up the key from the bag by my feet and put it on the table.
She looks at it for a moment before realizing what it is.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think that, all in all, that studio had a positive effect on me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Coming into contact with Shuho's raw writing helped me convey my feelings to you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But I won't go there anymore. I can keep on living without Shuho.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: As long as I know you're somewhere out there, I can keep on going.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I'm right next to you?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm happy you feel this way about me. I know that you really mean it right now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But I'm not young enough to think this will last forever.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I don't want to be a burden on you.
She simply stares at me in silence.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Anyway...
I clear my throat and return her gaze.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I don't need to chase after Shuho's shadow any longer. I'll write my next work because you said you wanted to read it. I wanna write it for you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I don't need the key anymore.
She gives me a slow, deliberate nod.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Okay, I'll take it back.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Just know that I don't think you need to go to that studio either.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think the same, yes.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What do you wanna do? If you don't want the key, I can hold onto it.
I watch her stare down at the key for a moment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think it will take me some time...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I don't feel as trapped as I did before. By my father, or by that place.
She says, her gaze fixed on the key.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Neither of us needs this key, but it'll be needed when the studio is sold off someday, so I'll keep it safe.
She says, raising her gaze to me.
I answer with a nod.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I went grocery shopping while you went to pick up your things. There's something I really wanted to make for you tonight.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, really?
She quirks a smile.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Could it be mackerel?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Correct.
I watch from behind as Rin works in the kitchen.
She's so adept with the knife now that I can scarcely believe she was so clumsy not so long ago.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: How many fish have you prepared?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I forgot. I ate them pretty much every day. For both lunch and dinner a few times, actually.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: The fishmonger even remembers me now. He thinks I just love horse mackerel.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I can imagine.
Rin laughs as she cuts into the first fish.
Her movement is smooth and fluid as a brook.
She looks back at me, her eyes full of confidence.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: How many points?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: A hundred, definitely. You're better than me. I don't think I can score you anymore.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes!
She has the sweetest of smiles on her face.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You really hate losing, huh?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yep!
Rin reaches out for the second fish, cleans off the scales, and starts filleting it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I didn't ever want to lose to someone who looked at you with so much hate.
Rin says, just as she cuts the head off the fish.
I stare at it for a moment.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Why?
She looks back at me.
I see a shade of uneasiness tinge her expression.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Why what?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I said some horrible things to you that day.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I was completely out of line, and I hurt you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I thought our relationship was over that day.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But you...
She shifts her attention back to the fish, slices its belly open and washes away the innards.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I was really sad that day.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I understood what you were saying.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You and your ex-wife...
Her knife glides across the fish's back, opening the way to its insides without a sound.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: There's no way I can erase the time you spent with her.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's why I started seeing it as a competition I didn't want to lose.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: No matter how silly and childish it was.
She finishes filleting the second fish.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm pretty messed up, huh?
She looks back at me.
Her smile is defiant and confident.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Almost as weird and messed up as you. Don't you think we're just made for each other?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Right?
I nod in response.
Somehow, I feel as though I'm always nodding along with her.
The fish Rin prepared are cleaned well and have the perfect texture. Nothing less than absolutely delicious.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It's really good. I'm amazed by what you can push yourself to achieve just because you don't want to lose.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Really, though, I was worried when you stopped responding to me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, sorry about that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: For not answering, and for yelling at you like that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm really sorry.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's fine.
Her gentle smile makes me feel like things are gonna be all right.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I know how hurt you felt, too. You laid it all out in your writing.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: And you came back, so...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Back then, when I sent the picture, you were in the bathroom, weren't you?
I nod.
I wrote everything in the manuscript that Rin read, even what happened in that bathroom.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: My message reached you right before you went through with it, right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If I was too early or too late, I'm sure we wouldn't be here right now...
Rin trails off.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's like we had always been gears grinding against each other...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But that moment was the first time our gears meshed together.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You may be right.
Our eyes meet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's a beautiful thought. I'll remember that.
She blinks slowly and nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: There's a lot to think about now. About the future, I mean.
I let out a tired chuckle.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: For example, what about your job at the academy?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think they'll let the whole being absent from work without permission thing slide if I grovel a little.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But putting the moves on a student, that's a whole different matter.
She squints her eyes, a little astounded.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Obviously. We don't need to tell anyone about that.
I remember the first day I was absent, Watanabe was the one who called.
I need to get in touch with him later.
No, wait. He's probably in Yakushima right now.
Maybe it'd be a bad idea to call him about work in the middle of his vacation.
My eyes wander about as I think, but they settle on Rin.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Is your divorce finalized yet?
She avoids my gaze.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: We're still in negotiations. But it's proceeding.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I actually got an email from my ex-wife's lawyer just now.
Her expression goes from relieved to anxious in a moment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Just now? What did it say?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ah, um, if you don't mind talking about it, that is.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It was about the house we had together.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It'll become her property. I was notified that I have to vacate it before the month is over.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But why?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Is it because of what I did in front of her that day?
I slowly shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's got nothing to do with it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: From the very start, I declared that I was willing to let them take care of the division of property as they saw fit.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It happened because of me, just like I wrote.
Rin nods anxiously.
Shouko may have seen what Rin did as a sign of me being unfaithful.
Perhaps she started feeling that there was no need to have mercy on me if we both were cheating on the other.
Whatever the case may be, this is all conjecture. I'll just make Rin feel guilty if I mention any of it.
She stands up and walks to the bedroom.
I can faintly hear her rummaging around on the other side of the wall.
After a moment, she comes back and sits down again.
And then...
She places a key on the table.
Again?
But this isn't the key to Shuho's studio.
It's...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: The key to this house.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: For you.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin, I don't think that's...
She shakes her head vehemently.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Why so shy all of a sudden?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Think of it as helping me be at ease. Take it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If you don't, I won't be able to stop thinking about that day.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Should I take this as permission to come and go whenever I want?
She slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'd like you to live here, rather.
She then turns her gaze down to the table.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Rin, that's...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It can just be until you find another place to stay. Don't see it as a huge commitment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Living in a hotel costs money, and it's better than sleeping under some bridge.
I stare at her for a while.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Man, I'm a failure as a teacher, huh?
I say, shaking my head in defeat.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll look for a place of my own, though. I can't settle in a house that Shuho left for you.
A smile comes back to her face.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Then how about just during summer break?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: We'll live together while we write our novels. Does that sound good?
I laugh at myself.
We humans don't change that easily, huh?
I'm more and more convinced of this.
I took her virginity, thoroughly made love to her for a whole night, and I'm still worried about what people might think.
And if I keep trying to appease some imaginary ethical boogeyman, at this point, all I'll do is make her feel lonely.
I nod in acceptance of Rin's proposal.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It'll be our very own writing camp.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes!
And so, the odd pair started living together.
I went back home, packed up the minimal necessities, and brought them back Rin's house.
The summer days roll by as we read books and take walks together.
After she makes dinner, I wash the dishes and brew coffee for us.
We drink coffee and work on our manuscripts before heading to bed and getting on with more pleasurable activities.
That's the daily routine we've gotten ourselves into as of late.
We didn't feel like going out today, so instead we're working on our laptops side by side.
Rin's manuscript isn't going so smoothly.
I sneak a glance at her.
She's looking down the screen, rubbing at her temples in frustration.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Professor?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yes?
I turn to her and wait for her to continue.
Her eyes stay glued to the display.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: How does one even write a novel?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If I knew that, I'd be rich already.
She raises her face and looks up at me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But you can write!
I shake my head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You literally did.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I wrote something, sure, but that was more a letter than a novel. I'm no good at novels.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Last time I tried to write, someone told me I couldn't depict people.
Rin shrinks back, realization dawning on her face.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I wish I knew how to write a novel.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I shouldn't have been so arrogant...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Hahahah.
She stares daggers at me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What's so funny?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nothing.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I can't wait to read what you'll come up with.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Why do you have to be so mean?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Stop it. You're making me too nervous to write anything at all, in case it turns out bad.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Some teacher you are. Aren't you supposed to help the students who are struggling?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're an honor student. No need to treat you with kiddie gloves.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You big meanie!
I laugh again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You read lots of books. For a start, how about you try writing something you'd like to read?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I'm writing it for you to read.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: So? I want to know what kind of things you like to read.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Well, I suppose I can hardly talk.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If that kind of vague advice helped, I would've written my first novel long ago.
She nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Books I like, huh? Hmm, what kind of stuff have I read recently...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I just kinda read without thinking much, so nothing really sticks in my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: How about we go to a bookstore?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Going out for a walk is good when you're having a little writer's block.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: And looking at bookshelves filled with different books to your own can be fun.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Right.
We decide to hit up our usual bookstore.
It's a twenty minute bus ride in the opposite direction from campus.
There's basically no one that could recognize us here.
We can't go around being too conspicuous in the areas around the campus.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Remember we're writing for fun, first and foremost. Don't overthink it too much.
I turn to her as we walk down the sidewalk, and she giggles.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I remember saying something similar to you once.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, yeah.
The memory brings another bout of laughter.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: And you were right. Just write whatever comes to you. Don't worry too much. If you wanna sing, then you start by humming.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Especially for people with your personality type.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes, all right.
Just like today, we've spent many a summer afternoon in this bookstore.
We go our separate ways at the entrance and wander around looking at whatever takes our fancy.
If either of us feels like going back, we reunite and go home.
And if we find a book that we really want to keep reading, we buy it together.
Today, each of us does their personal search.
Rin focuses on the "How to write a novel" section of a shelf.
I keep an eye on her from a distance.
I didn't think she'd struggle with creating something to this extent.
I'm seeing another side to her.
She can be very mature, but also very young in some aspects.
Those extremes live in balance inside of her.
Not having anything specific in mind, I eye the literature section.
In the foreign literature section, there are new books by writers that have been active since I was a student.
Now that's dedication.
For them, writing for an audience must be some kind of second nature.
Even now, they still manage to write interesting stories, and many of their works have been adapted to visual mediums.
Their books fly off the shelves like Shuho's.
But the difference between a person who is worn down by writing and one who grows with the experience only becomes more marked with time.
I move on to the section for new Japanese books.
There, I spy a familiar name.
There are two stacks of different books by the same author.
One of them has a sticker that says "Over 100,000 copies sold! The new Hatano Shuho!"
I take a look at the cover.
It wasn't Shuho's name that I spotted, but the one of the actual author.
The name of that young writer who was talking at that event back then.
One of the books is published by the company Shouko works for.
The other one is from a major publisher.
The one with the impressive sticker is from the big publisher.
I pick up the books and take a look at the colophons.
The one from the big publisher is a sixth edition, and the one Shouko was in charge of a first edition.
Considering how big a print run for a new author usually is, there's a huge magnitude of difference between them.
I idly stare at the cover of the work edited by Shouko.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Professor?
I turn back to see Rin looking at the book besides me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What's wrong?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Ah, uh, nothing.
Her gaze stops on the sticker on the book, and she seems to realize something when she reads the name of the author on the cover.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Which one did your ex-wife work on?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: This one.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mmh...
Rin takes the book from my hand, and reaches out for the one that's still laying on the shelf.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Ah.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll buy them.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You don't need to...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Not with my money. I'll use Shuho's royalties.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Isn't this guy supposed to be his replacement?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Let's read it. I'm kinda curious. Not enough to use my own money, though.
Rin takes the books to the register with a slightly intimidating smile that doesn't leave any room for rebuttal.
We sit on a park bench near the bookstore and get to reading.
First, I read the book my ex-wife edited.
Even ignoring the fact that they're a commercially published author, this person is on the up and up, and leagues ahead of me.
There's not much to say about the story itself.
It's the kind of a story I've read before, in a style I've seen somewhere else.
That's all.
The publisher deemed it had commercial value and pushed it out.
You could say he's doing his job as a novelist well enough.
After reading the first fifty or so pages, Rin and I exchange books.
The work that apparently sold 100,000 copies is essentially the same as the one with Shouko's editing.
It's interesting how he managed to sell so many copies just with the backing of a big publisher.
Could it PR? Maybe the title for this one was more attention grabbing?
Again, I read the first 50 pages of the book, and then close it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: How was it?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Mmh...
I take a glance at the cover.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I guess it's fine.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: This author's your ex-wife's lover, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Probably.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I like your writing way better.
I raise my head and look up at her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thanks, that means a lot.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But he's a professional novelist, and I'm not. I don't have any desire to be one either.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If we use commercial value as the metric for how successful your writing is, I'm completely beat by him.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: At least, that's what I think.
She's staring straight at me.
She doesn't nod or shake her head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: This book my ex-wife edited...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I don't know if it sold well or not.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But on some level, this writer must have responded to what my ex-wife wanted with this work. They probably learned to trust each other by working together, and that brought them closer together.
Like we never were, I remind myself.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: The kitchen of... what used to be our house was almost untouched, like no people ever lived in that house.
A slight frown touches her lips.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No one cooked there. It was just a place for me to brew coffee and smoke.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I... always felt guilty for never meeting my wife's expectations. That's why I never complained or asked anything of her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think what I really wanted was to lead a happy life like everybody else.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But when I realized my life was going nowhere and I wasn't happy, I just suppressed those feelings.
I stop there.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Because you betrayed her expectations?
Facing her, I nod.
Then I flip through the book's pages.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I feel sad reading this. How could I have been so stupid for so many years?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If I could have risen to meet her expectations like this, maybe I could have actually made it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I suppose that in the end, our marriage didn't amount to much more than the union of a failed writer and an editor with no talent.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But...
I raise my head and look into Rin's eyes.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's in the past now. What happened between me and my ex-wife is just that. Now I'm with you, and I'm happy with the time we have.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I've got no regrets.
We stay silent for a moment, with only the sound of cicadas in the background.
I gaze idly out at the people passing by our bench.
Eventually, Rin breaks the silence.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Professor.
I turn back to her.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Let's go shopping then head home.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Shopping?
She nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: For dinner.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, right.
We buy the ingredients for dinner at a small supermarket on the way to the bus stop.
As we step out of the store and I start to head towards the stop, Rin tugs on my sleeve.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Not that way.
She looks up at me, an innocent smile on her face.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: We're going to your house today. It's the opposite direction, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: My house?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You walked there after you got off the bus the day we met, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, but...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll make you dinner in that unused kitchen.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: There's no one there, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, but next month...
It'll become Shouko's property.
I already got the official notice.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But this month it's still your house, right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If the kitchen in your house really is as clean as new, I want to use it.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's okay, right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Excuse me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Whoa, what a nice place.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: The ceiling is pretty high. It feels nice and spacious.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Come on in. It's nothing too fancy.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Can I use the kitchen?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's what we're here for.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Can I use the tableware and everything?
I nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Go ahead. I get the feeling they're going to the trash sooner rather than later.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: All right.
I sit at the table and stare idly at her.
I had never dreamed that Rin would ever cook in this kitchen.
Noticing my gaze, she looks back.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What are you looking at?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nothing. Uh, it just feels kind of strange.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You cooking in this house.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's right. A girl who hasn't been alive for even half as long as you is cooking her heart out to make you happy here.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Doesn't that make you the happiest man on Earth?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It should be illegal to be this happy. Oh, is that the police on the door?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: The night is still young.
Rin lines up dishes up on the table.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I think we've had enough rice for a while, and there would be leftovers, so I made pasta today.
She's prepared creamy pasta with mushrooms and salmon, and salad.
Plus bowls of clear soup.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Looks delicious.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Can't eat with only one hand, though.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You know I don't read when there's good company to share the food with.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Lucky for me!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Can I dig in?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Go right ahead.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thanks.
I wrap a generous amount of pasta around my fork and bring it to my mouth.
I can taste Rin's cooking skill improving with each day.
And I'm not too prideful to let her know.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's because I'm cooking for you. I never really tried when I was cooking for myself.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm the same way. I just ate whatever when I was on my own.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think I only started really enjoying meals after we started living together.
Rin beams at me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Is it like the dinner time that you imagined?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: The happy life you must have envisioned when you bought this house.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, it's that and much more.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: The food is amazing, and above all...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're with me now. It exceeds whatever I imagined when I got this house.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Not yet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: When we're done having dinner, we'll take a bath together...
I feel something warm sliding over my thigh.
Her toes are sinuously gliding their way between my legs.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Then we'll go the room you and your ex-wife slept in and do it all night long.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: All wet from the bath. We're gonna do it like animals until we're too exhausted to keep going.
Her touch is setting my nerves on fire.
I gulp in anticipation.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll make you feel miles better than she ever did. And I'll make you moan louder than she ever could.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll make all the wishes you had when you bought this house come true.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Sounds good, doesn't it?
Slowly, she withdraws her feet.
Then, with that little mischievous smile of hers curling across her face, she returns to her pasta.
After the meal, we wash the dishes together and put the utensils back in their place.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...Rin.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mm?
She cocks her head and looks up at me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If you wanna make my dreams come true, can we add one more thing to our schedule for tonight?
She quirks the corners of her mouth into a sly smile.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Of course. What do you want to do?
I throw a glance at the living room, and then back at her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I wanna write together.
Her eyes widen in surprise.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It always was a dream of mine. To spend time together like that with the person I love.
She smiles sweetly and nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Okay, let's do that.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thanks.
I bring my paper and pens from my room on the second floor.
Rin brews us some coffee, and we sit opposite each other.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Okay, let's decide on a theme and try to write a short story. Something that will fit within about five pages.
Rin nods dutifully.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Sounds fun.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Don't worry about who's gonna read it. Just take it easy and write whatever you want.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Think you can do it?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll try.
I nod in response, take a sip of the coffee Rin brewed, and pick up my pen.
For a while, she seems deep in thought with her chin resting on the palm of her hand, but she starts writing before long.
I glance at her from time to time.
She's scribbling furiously. I wouldn't be surprised if she ends up with ten pages.
Looks like she's onto something.
I go back to my own paper, trying to hide my smile so she doesn't get distracted.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Done?
Rin nods, blowing out a satisfied breath.
I smile at her in response.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's short, but I finally managed to write something.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What did you write?
She flashes a meaningful smile at me and makes that look she usually reserves for when we're in bed.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Wanna read?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Is the sky blue?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Will you go easy on your criticism?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: My baseline will be the first evaluation you gave me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You're gonna break my heart!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm pulling your leg. I get it. That's not even the point here. I just wanna read something you wrote, that's all.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Okay.
She bashfully presents me with her manuscript.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I showed you mine, so now it's your turn.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Gladly.
I hand her my manuscript.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Spending time together like this is fun, huh?
I nod and begin reading her story.
It's about...
A boy and a girl who have lived their entire lives underground, knowing nothing of the world above. One day they encounter a little bird and start to imagine the outside world.
It strikes me as an odd story at first.
But strangely enough, I'm fascinated by it.
I somehow feel like I know this story.
It's not a structural resemblance to something like The Blue Bird story. I just somehow get the feeling that I'm very familiar with the world she's depicting here.
Perhaps her ability to evoke a landscape is just that impressive.
The story ends with the little bird dying, and the two children digging a grave for it in the ground.
It reminds me of that empty birdcage in Rin's room.
Perhaps this story came from her own personal experiences, just like mine.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Have you finished?
Rin's voice snaps me back to reality.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah. It's a strange story, and a curious world you created here.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: However...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Your writing made the scenery really vivid in my mind. It was so real, I felt like I knew it from somewhere.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I really like this story.
Her eyes gleam brilliantly.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Is this really the first time you've written a short story?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I've tried to write something like it a few times before.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Figures.
She raises her face to look at me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It feels like you're used to writing, and...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: To be honest, I think you're talented. Now I'm looking forward to the end of summer even more.
A smile of relief touches her face.
I'm not just flattering her, and she seems to know that.
Her writing truly has a captivating and genuine nature to it that makes you want to keep reading.
It's nothing logical.
It's the spark of latent talent.
What I feel after reading this...
Is a little similar to what I felt after reading Shuho's story in that seminar anthology.
Maybe if I read this back when I was young, I would have been blown away.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's really good.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think you should have more confidence. The pitfall people like you tend to fall into is underestimating yourself more than you should.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It happens a lot. I think you should be more assertive.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: There's such a thing as affinity when it comes to liking a piece of writing, isn't there?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's right.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: When you said you liked it, it made me so much happier than if you had said it was good or bad.
I nod.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Your story was really fun to read too. Were you writing about this house?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.
I wrote a story about an ordinary man who gets his dream home, and lives happily.
But in time, younger colleagues than him get nicer houses.
Others marry younger and more beautiful brides than his.
The ideal life he envisioned suddenly seems small to him, and he becomes completely fascinated by a leaflet promoting a condominium that he finds one day.
It's surreal little story that speaks of how society always makes us want more, even to our own detriment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You really have a cynical bone in there, huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I guess it's hard not to be when you've spent your time in the shade for so long.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahaha! But it adds a touch of personality to what you write. I wouldn't be able to come up with such a satirical take just from this house.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I guess it's one of the perks of not being that talented. Can't help feeling like I gotta push back against it all.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But tonight you're going far beyond the ideals you had when you bought this house.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: You still have it in you to be this bitter about society?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...Nice point.
She giggles and nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: If you're with me, are you gonna go after a prettier girl when they show up?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Never.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah! That's a load off my mind, then.
As usual, I'm overwhelmed by her.
Rin always knows how to take the initiative between us.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But, uh...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think you could maybe keep going with this story a little longer, if you like. I think it's a nice thread to follow.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Think you could write a second part to this?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah. I think I may have a couple more things to write about for this story.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: And I had lots of fun doing it today.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Me too.
Suddenly, her gentle smile...
...fades away.
It feels like she's gazing at something deep inside my soul.
I meet her gaze with my own.
Her eyes shift, and I notice she's staring at the album I tried to give her once. It's sitting on a shelf behind me.
I take a good look at her.
Perhaps she's thinking of that picture where my ex-wife and I are smiling together.
Silent, I simply gauge her expression.
She turns to me and gives me a little smile, a mysterious twinkle in her rose-colored eyes.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: How about we take that bath?
Keeping her gaze pinned on me, Rin gets to her feet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: S-Sure.
She walks up to me and gently takes my hand.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Let's go?
I nod as I feel my heart beat faster, and let her lead me by the hand into the bathroom.
We strip each other's clothes off and get into the shower, kissing passionately.
And after, without even bothering to dry ourselves, we drench the floor on our way to the second floor bedroom, where I push Rin onto the bed with an almost animal impulse.
She's lying in the same bed that once belonged to me and Shouko.
Rin smiles as she opens herself up for me. The shine of the lights does amazing things to her wet, glistening figure.
And just like she said, we spend the whole night making love atop the damp bed until morning comes and we give in to the sweet fatigue, still in a tight embrace.
At the end of August, nearing the end of summer break, I get in contact with Watanabe.
I get a response from him right away, and I tell him I'd like to talk.
He made time for me immediately, and we're supposed to meet in this cafe today.
I'm the first to arrive.
I sit in the smoking area, and Watanabe shows up by the time I finish my second cig.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Long time no see.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You sure you oughta look so calm? What happened with work? You skipped the end-of-term ceremony, man.
I laugh in response.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Guess I did. I never skipped a class even when I was a student.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: And you thought it'd be cute to do it when you're a an old moose already?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: A lot of stuff happened, I suppose.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I can imagine.
I stare at Watanabe.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Well, I imagined you might do something like this, so I can't say it was a huge shock.
I nod and spread the divorce papers on the table.
So far, they only have my signature on them.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So I just gotta write down my name as witness and sign it?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Apparently.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Okay.
Watanabe plucks a ballpoint pen from his bag and proceeds to carefully write and sign his name.
It was news to me that you needed a third party to sign divorce papers.
I was planning on telling him about the divorce anyway, after things calmed down, so I decided to ask him to be my witness.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Sorry for asking you to do this out of nowhere.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're the only friend I could think of that I could even ask to help me with this.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, so I'm your friend? What an honor.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I wouldn't ask you if you weren't.
I fold the now signed divorce papers and put them in my bag.
With almost uncannily opportune timing, the waiter comes to take our orders.
Watanabe orders iced coffee.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So?
He takes a cig out of his chest pocket, lights it up, and pops it into his mouth.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Mmh?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You've been well?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, I'd say so.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Well, you don't sound so cheerful. What is it? Missing the wife already?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Not at all.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Whoa, ice cold.
Watanabe laughs.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So, if you need a witness, that means there's no dispute over the mediation and all that, right?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You're pretty knowledgeable about this, huh?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I kinda looked it up before coming here.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I guess it's good that it's not a messy divorce. Not like I know why you even divorced in the first place.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Mm... Well, there was a trigger, but I don't think there was one concrete reason.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I suppose that's not unheard of.
The waiter brings his iced coffee and he begins sipping on it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: How was Yakushima?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Pretty fun. Ah, sorry. I totally forgot your souvenir.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Don't sweat it.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I'll bring it with me when we're back at work.
Watanabe stubs his cigarette out in the ashtray.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: How about you? You go anywhere?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Nah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: How about a change of pace, then? Traveling alone could help you feel better.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Why not let your hair down a little? Your wife kept you on a pretty tight leash, right?
I give him a bitter smile.
Oh, I've already let my hair down plenty. So much so that I may not be fit to be a teacher anymore.
I'm living at a student's home, and I'd rather not describe what we get up to every night under the covers.
But I've gotta keep quiet about all that, unless I want to lose the little bit of life I have left.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I had my own kind of fun this summer break, I think.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, really? What, you've been writing?
I nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: A lot of stuff happened, but I think life has gotten a lot more bearable. I'm enjoying each day now.
Watanabe looks extremely surprised.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Whoa, you really needed that divorce, huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...Yeah.
I pay the bill in the end.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Thanks, boss.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Don't worry. I went and called you out of nowhere for this.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, by the way, what about your house? You weren't living apart, were you?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Did your wife leave? Or did you?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...I think I gave the house away.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I gave up my right to it and left the house. I don't know if she's living there with her new man or something.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Oh, I see. So you're living alone.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Uh, yeah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Is your new place around here?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, I guess.
Watanabe's expression turns suspicious, and he frowns.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Arishima?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You're not living alone, are you? You're with someone!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm alone, I swear.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Man, you're such a bad liar. You're not fooling anyone.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So, what kind of person is she? Here I was all worried, and you already have a sweetheart waiting for you!

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: All you told me was how your ex-wife likes to ride around in fancy new cars and stuff.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Right...
After thinking for a moment, I figure it's weirder to be so secretive, and decide to tell him the bare bones of the situation.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I have a partner. She's letting me stay with her while I find a new place.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Yeah, right! You sly dog.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm taking it easy. We read books every day and write together. It's a really nice life with her.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Huh? That sounds perfect for you. I'm happy for you, man.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, I'm pretty happy. I can go drinking whenever, too, so feel free to invite me out anytime.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Sounds like a plan!

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You taking the bus or train?

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Train. How about you?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Bus, but I can come with you to the station and catch it from there.
We start walking to the station.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So are you gonna get married again to this mystery lady?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Uh...
I shake my head.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm not thinking about that right now. I feel like we're just sharing a moment in our lives right now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm not young enough to fall in love blindly like that. If she finds someone else that's more appropriate for her, I'll leave.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: So it's someone younger than you, then.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Whoa, you sure mellowed out. Guess all it took was a divorce!
He sure knows how to make me chuckle.
Divorce wasn't all it took, not by a long shot.
It took almost killing myself and having someone read all my regret and negative thoughts about life to get me here.
But that's something I can't tell even Watanabe.
The whole story of the studio, and Shuho's diaries, and how it ended up with me being romantically involved with Rin.
As long as I keep working as a teacher, I can't tell anyone about this—at least not until Rin has graduated.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Hey, it was nice catching up.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Same here.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: You look better now. I'm glad to see some life breathed into those old bones of yours.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: I seriously thought you might have died when you didn't pick up the phone.
Watanabe has a discerning eye.
I never cease to be amazed by him.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Thanks for the help. I'm living better now.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Make sure you keep it that way. See you in September.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Watanabe
texts.text: Give my regards to that sweet little girlfriend of yours.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Will do.
Watanabe laughs one more time as he leaves for the ticket gate.
After seeing him off, I take out my phone and open the message app.
I'm heading back.
I send a message, and make my way to the bus stop.
I'm glad it happened when he wasn't around.
I tried not to worry about it, but soon enough there won't be any way to hide it.
The scents I like have changed as of late.
I used to like the smell of coffee, but now I can hardly stand it; I like the smell of oil now, too.
I feel drowsy all the time.
I've never been in the best of health.
I'm used to being sick from something most of the time.
I'm used to irregular menstrual cycles.
But...
It's never been so late before.
I still had an appetite, so I didn't think it was morning sickness.
But I vomited a lot today.
I looked it up, and the symptoms for morning sickness vary from person to person, but I have all of them.
But he always uses contraception.
Every day, except the first day we did it.
That was the only day he finished inside me.
I love him, probably more than he imagines.
If there's anything I know to be true in my heart, it's that.
But...
That's not the problem.
I can't even imagine myself becoming a mother.
I'm so scared of rejecting my child, like my parents denied my existence throughout my life.
I was stupid.
Maybe I wasn't ready to make love to him, after all.
Somewhere in my heart, I thought that only one time wouldn't hurt.
No, the desire to connect with him without anything in the way won out in the end.
I wanted him to love me more, to go crazy for me.
It never occurred to me that I would get pregnant from my very first time.
I was so dumb.
Why didn't I take the morning after pill?
I was foolish and ignorant.
And in the end, my stupidity might end up costing a life.
My hands tremble at the thought.
Unconsciously, I bring my shivering hands to my stomach.
I don't understand why I did that instinctively.
Holding my stomach, I sit down.
I want this all to be a misunderstanding on my part.
A mere coincidence.
Yes, it has to be.
I keep telling myself that, but the trembling doesn't go away.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Hey there.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, you're back.
I find Rin sitting at the table. She looks up at me and smiles.
She's holding her phone in her lap.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's odd.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: The phone. I never see you using it, usually.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, really?
I nod.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: My generation are always on our phones, you know?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm aware.
In the kitchen, I run some water into the kettle.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Want some coffee?
Rin thinks for a moment, then shakes her head slowly.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll pass, thanks.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Was Professor Watanabe well?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Yeah, he's as fit as a fiddle.
Rin wears a pleasant smile on her face.
After dinner, we both sit together to write on our laptops.
Ever since we wrote together that night in my old house, she's been hitting the keys at a constant pace.
For a while there, she seemed to have gotten into the groove of writing, but recently I've caught her staring at her screen in silence for long stretches of time.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What's up?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Huh?
She raises her face from the screen and looks at me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Getting writer's block again?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, no. I'm just thinking how to continue.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You seem to have been going at a good pace so far. How much do you have left?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm wondering the same.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Whatever the case, I'll need to finish it before summer break is over.
Rin looks down blankly at her hands on the keyboard.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: What's it about?
At my question, she raises her eyes.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: ...Someone I've been trying not to think about, I guess.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I see.
It seems that she's using her own experiences as inspiration.
Everyone's first work is more or less a projection of him or herself.
Perhaps, through her writing, she's looking for answers to questions she hasn't yet resolved within herself.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I might change my mind and write something else. So I can't let you read it yet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: No need to rush it. I'll wait for as long as you need.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah, thanks.
After that, she turns to her screen and hits the keys for a while, but stops soon after.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Tomorrow...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'm going to see some places. Summer break's almost over.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh...
Her voice lowers to a murmur.
I answer with a simple nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It'd be weird if I commuted to work from here.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: There are lots of single rooms to rent. I'm not picky, so I'm sure I can find a nice enough place.
Her eyes swim about the living room.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'll make sure to find something near here. You can come and visit me.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah, I'd like that.
I let out a huge sigh, and it seems like my soul leaves along with my breath.
The moment I saw the result, my heart sank down to my stomach.
I simply stare in shock at the two lines.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Why?
I know why, yet I still ask the empty air.
If this was just me reaping what I'd sown, it'd be fine.
If I was the only one getting hurt, I wouldn't care.
But...
I press my hand to my forehead, feeling an imminent migraine coming.
I can't have a baby.
I can't be a parent.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm sorry.
The words spill out of my mouth for some reason.
I think they're directed at the life inside of me... and to him.
If anyone finds out that I'm pregnant with his baby, his whole life will change.
He may even come to regret ever meeting me.
Just like Hatano Shuho hated the woman that birthed me, he may hate me too.
I'm scared.
I'm sorry I don't have the courage to be upfront with you.
I'm sorry I don't have the courage to tell you...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm sorry...
Among the gynecology and obstetrics centers that I looked up, I found a few that don't require you to register with them.
One of them was run by a female doctor.
I came out of the west exit of Shinjuku station into an office district, and found the hospital after walking for a while. It was on the fifth floor of a tall building.
The doctor had long hair, and her features struck me as very neat and prim.
Before I could tell her I wanted an abortion, she put on an ultrasound image of my stomach on the screen.
I lay there on the hard examination bed and listened distractedly as she pointed to some little white dots, telling me that's the baby.
I stare at the image.
Unable to sort out my feelings, tears blurred my view.
I was trying to erase this child from the world.
I was trying to dispose of it, not even treating it as a life.
I was the only one who would mourn it.
Lying on the bed, tears rolled down my face.
After the ultrasound, the doctor explained the procedure for issuing a pregnancy certificate. As soon as she stopped talking, I told her that I wanted an abortion.
I told her that I had no parents and that I couldn't get a consent form from the father. I asked her to book me in for an abortion as soon as possible.
She nodded and informed me that it could be done as soon as tomorrow.
She explained that, if it's what I want, it's better to abort as soon as possible.
But if I change my mind, I'm free to cancel at any point, even on the day of the procedure. She asked me if I understood many times.
I interjected with nods and got up from my seat after she was done explaining.
She asked me I'd like to take a copy of the sonogram.
The doctor got up after me and handed me the photo.
It's just a little cluster of white dots contrasting against the black and gray of the background.
I trace my fingers over the tiny white blobs. They're so small I would have overlooked them if it wasn't for the doctor being nice enough to mark them with her pen.
This little life's whole world is me.
I wonder if the woman who gave birth to me also looked at me like this. A little white dot in a sea of dark.
What did she think, I wonder.
Maybe she thought she could use it to entrap Hatano Shuho.
Perhaps that's what she thought.
But...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: ...She gave birth to me.
I can't even recall her voice, but she gave birth to me.
The loneliness my parents forced on me has nothing to do with this baby.
If I reject them...
I'll become the same as my parents.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Can I...
Can I be a mother to this baby?
I'm tired of walking.
My feet hurt like hell.
I visited three real estate agents and was shown seven apartments.
It took me all damn day in the end.
Now that I think about it, I haven't been out for a full day all summer long.
Since I'm spending the summer together with Rin, we should have gone on a trip somewhere.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: So they were pretty much the same when it came to amenities, but I never noticed before how much the thickness of the walls can change the ventilation and feeling a room has.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Given my budget, I may as well go for one of those instead of a high-rise.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: High-rise apartments have such low ceilings to hide all the steel beams, and I like high ceilings because they help the place feel less cramped.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, is that so?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: They also recommended something called weekly apartments. The procedure to rent one is easy, you don't need a lot of paperwork, and you can just give a down payment and not worry about annual income checks and all that.
I triumphantly dump all the house hunting knowledge I acquired today on Rin while she's preparing stuff in the kitchen.
She listens to all of it with a sweet smile on her face.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: And that was my day. How was yours? Do anything fun?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Shopping. I wanted to cook a proper meal for a change.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh? But you always cook proper—and delicious—meals.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Oh, you know that's not true. I know I don't usually make a big, fancy spread, but I splurged a little today.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: We celebrating something?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: No, not really. I just feel a little peckish today.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Huh? That's a surprise.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: A welcome surprise, to be sure.
She lived up to her word.
A bunch of fancy looking dishes are lined up on the table today.
There's medium rare steak slices, mashed potatoes, bean soup, and a bowl of salad.
Even baguettes and butter.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Whoa, this really is a feast.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Don't you think you could go out with no regrets if this was our last supper?
Rin says, as she sits in front of me.
That comment makes me think for a moment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Well, our summer together isn't over just yet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Our summer isn't over until we read each other's work.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll try my best.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Let's dig in.
I nod and bring a spoonful of beans to my mouth.
I notice that Rin doesn't drink any coffee after dinner today either.
I'm the only one drinking it.
After we're done with dinner, we settle down to write on our laptops again.
I'm currently revising my second draft.
After all that thinking yesterday, it seems she's finally continuing her story today.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Looks like...

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Hm?
When she stops typing for a moment, I get her attention.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Looks like you made up your mind.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Really?
I nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Feel like you can write now?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I feel like I know exactly what I need to do now.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's good.
She smiles at me.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Summer break's almost over.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Why don't we go somewhere?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Somewhere?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I mean, we haven't gone out much. It feels like kind of a waste of a good vacation.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If you have anywhere you'd like to go, let's do it.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Our last outing was in Sakuragicho, and I think I'd like to replace those memories with something more fun.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Ahahah, yeah.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: We can leave tomorrow, if you want. How about it?
She thinks for a moment.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Going on a trip does sound fun...
There's a glint of sadness in her smile.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You have other plans?
Rin stares into my eyes.
Then she slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm not going anywhere. This is where I want to be.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's a nice idea, but we don't need to do anything special. I just want to be together at home, just like we've been this whole time.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You sure?
She nods.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I mean, when summer break is over...
Her gaze wanders in the space between the two of us.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: When it's over, all these summer days will become precious memories, right?

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: That's why... I want to stay like this.
I nod in response.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: All right. Then we stay like this. Tomorrow, and the day after that.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yes.
Rin is aware that the time we're sharing is going to end.
And she's right that our lives will probably change as soon as the next semester starts.
Right now we're in our little period of grace.
If we're to build a truly strong bond, we must learn to coexist while also living our separate lives.
Now, whether we'll be able to do that will be tested when summer break is over.
We spent the last days of August in the same manner.
We read, wrote, and lived together in the same space.
We went about our activities, safe in each other's presence. And so, those dreamlike days flew by.
And now, it's the last day of August.
The last day of our summer break.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Here's mine.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: What kind of story is it?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It's about a middle-aged man who decides he wants to run a marathon. The story is about the little changes you can see in yourself when you put in the effort, and the hope they bring.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I think it's plain, simple, and doesn't really stand out from the crowd...

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But at least I mustered up the courage and patience to write even a shoddy little piece like this. Took me long enough.
I finish that last sentence with a little chuckle.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: If I started sooner, maybe I could've been earning my current salary from writing.
Rin nods, a little smile touching her lips.
I wait for her to say something.
As for her...
I see no laptop or papers in her hands.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Couldn't write anything in the end.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I lost the summer battle.
My eyes widen in surprise.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: But I saw you writing? I thought you had the rest of it planned out.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Still, I couldn't write it all the way to the end. Not yet.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Oh, I see.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: But I'll complete it someday.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: When I do, will you read it?
I give her a firm, deep nod.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I'd love to read it.
She smiles at me.
Then she turns to look at my manuscript.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I didn't finish mine, but can I read yours?
I nod and present it to her.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Of course. I wrote this for you.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm so happy.
She reads my manuscript until night falls.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's such a refreshing story. Perfect for summer.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: It's completely different from the things you're written so far.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Uh, it's kind of hard to put into words, but I suppose I didn't go as hard with this one.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: It just kinda let myself write naturally. It's been a long time since I last had that experience.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Yeah, I can feel that.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Of the pieces you've written, I think this is the one I'd like to keep reading again and again.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Well, I don't think there's much to get out of it from rereads. You probably won't come out thinking any different from it.
Upon hearing that, Rin smiles again.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I guess we have no regrets left from this summer.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: I have one. I couldn't read your story.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: That's one huge regret.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'm very sorry about that.
I laugh, and she keeps on smiling.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: I'll do my best so you can read it someday.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Write it at your own pace. You gotta walk if you wanna run.

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: Though I'm just repeating your words.

texts.name: Rin
texts.text: Hah. People who've never written anything always say the most insensitive things, huh?

texts.name: Arishima
texts.text: You bet.
Our laughter fills the room.
